data.title: Great pizza
data.text: Great food in a quaint little place. The pizza is fabulous & staff is outstanding! My 1st time there while visiting family, they had made reservations as seating is limited.

data.title: Thin Pizza Perfection!
data.text: Ok, it may have been Halloween weekend, but I have never been in a place where I had Ziggy Stardust for my bartender, and I was impressed.  Lol but more importantly, my wife and I have been to a LOT of pizza places, so much so that I might need to seek help for it, but Lucca's Grill in Bloomington has seriously got THE BEST thin crust pizza that I have ever eaten.  We ordered one large sausage and one large green pepper with mushroom, and they were so delicious that we didn't have any leftovers. (there were only 3 of us) and they were eaten with great zeal.  The sausage pizza was not a bit greasy like some places, and the crust was to die for, you can tell the ingredients are all fresh and beautiful and awesome.  You have to go.  The staff was also friendly and entertaining. If you are a pizza fanatic like me, this is the hidden gem you have been searching for your whole life.  I will be back.😀😀😀

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: We walked in and it was like a scene from the Godfather movies very cool atmosphere. Three of us ordered pizza which was thin crust and fantastic flavor  lots of toppings. The other ordered lasagna and she said it was fantastic.   Price was very reasonable and the food was out of this world.  If you are in Bloomington you should go. I know I will stop when in the area again.

data.title: YUMMY
data.text: The pizza is awesome and the atmosphere is a throwback to better times. If you are in the mood for great food and great times, then Lucca Grill is your final destination.

data.title: Good, Old Fashion, Bar and Grill
data.text: One of the first things you notice about Lucca is the stunning detail and attention they've paid to their decor and atmosphere. The inside is very welcoming, with decor consisting of historical newspaper clippings, sports memorabilia, and vintage furniture. Their tin ceiling is one of best you'll ever see. This is a place that hasn't changed in decades, and that is half of the appeal. Now on to the other half, the food. It's the standard bar food and Italian-American fare (pizza, wings, fried items), with one simple twist....they make it, and they make it perfect. That's all that needs to be said about that. This is a place where you can truly feel at ease and enjoy a good drink and a good meal.

data.title: Best Ever!
data.text: Hands down the best pizza anywhere, especially if you love thin crust.  We ALWAYS visit Lucca's when we are in town.  We have been coming here for many years.  The pizza, any topping, is a must order.  This visit we ordered the fried ravioli for an appetizer and it was great.  The meat sauce was the best.  Our pizza, pepperoni and mushroom, was wonderful as always.  Any time we get pizza from another place, it is always compared to Lucca's and no one has been able to beat it yet.

data.title: The best pizza restaurant in Bloomington, Illinois
data.text: Actually it maybe the best pizza restaurant in Illinois.  Don't know how long it's been there but it was there in the same location as when I attended the university there 50+ years ago.  I don't know how they've done it but they've maintained the same classic look and recipes all that time.  The only change I notice is that they've kept up with the times on draft beer selections (bigger and better).  No wonder then, that regardless of where our class reunions are hosted we always make it a point to get over to Lucca's at least once over the weekend, some of us twice or more.  Of course on special weekends they are mobbed, but they always give you an honest estimate on wait time and it's usually not that bad.  And given the visual and aromatic atmosphere in there, it's more that worth it.  PS:  In the interior photo, I think the gentleman second from the right (behind the bar) is the owner-manager.  He's been there for years and is one of the most friendly, welcoming hard working people in the restaurant business today.

data.title: Real Pizza is never Deep Dish
data.text: I revisited this place after 50 years (they had a used atmosphere for decades even then)  and had the same experience.  Great thin crust pizza which is also good as left overs (hot or cold).  The longevity and popularity of the place mean you likely will have a short wait for a table as they never had much real estate.  Thankfully, they have the "if it ain't broke don't fix it" attitude and concentrate on serving really good food cooked to order and never a penny for high priced furnishings or the latest fad decor.  (My current pet peeve is the uncomfortable High Tops tables and chairs -I actually graduated from highchairs 70 years ago).  Carry-out is popular but no delivery.  Service is honest (no "my name is Jane and I'll be pleased to be your server today") Just a friendly take your order style and they assume you are smart enough to figure out what they are, which is refreshing.

data.title: Nice little hole in the wall!
data.text:
Went with a group to this place recommended by a Bloomington resident.  The food was pretty good and the service was just okay.  I like places like this because it's a bit of a dive, but completely local.  No franchise feel to the place at all!  
We all had pizzas, and they were great.  I understand though that you can't go wrong with most anything on the menu.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Excellent environment and great pizza. Service is also outstanding. It's our favorite spot in Bloomington.

data.title: Greatest Pizza & neighborhood Bar
data.text: The best Thin Thin crust pizza maybe ever! Fun neighborhood bar, always hopping! Of course their other food is great as well! Overall just a great place to eat and have fun in Bloomington!

data.title: Love this Pizza!
data.text: Take the time to visit this long-standing establishment. It is an old family owned Italian restaurant and their pizza is unusual yet delicious with a very thin crust.  Everytime we visit this area we go to Lucca Grill. Delicious!

data.title: Slice of more than pizza-
data.text: Used to be DNC headquarters and JFK has set foot on the premises. That's beside the point- the pizza is good and the tap has a good selection most of the time. It's been around forever and the baldini is a local favorite. It's good and salty. Really thin crust. I'd recommend a visitor give it a try

data.title: Happy Birthday!
data.text: I first entered the Lucca Grill in late 1950's.  A student at IWU who was graduating.  Then in 1961 I began enjoying Lucca every Tuesday evening after singing with the Sound Of Illinois Barbershoppers.  If you look at the walls in Lucca Grill you will see photos and logos from the barbershoppers as well as a newspaper clipping from the New York Times.  Any Tuesday night after 9:30 pm you will be able to hear singing from the back table.  And why Happy Birthday?  I discovered Lucca Grill opened December 9, 1936 and will be 80 this year.  Guess what, I was born December 9, 1936 and will also be 80 this year.

data.title: Skip the pasta, go for the pizza
data.text:
We were a group of four. Two ordered a half order of pasta primavera with pesto, one ordered a roast beef sandwich, and I had a medium, thin crust, vegetarian pizza. All orders were placed at the same time.

The pasta dishes arrived 5 minutes before the roast beef sandwich and 10 minutes before my pizza. I thought my pizza was very good and I liked the choice of toppings. However those who ordered the pasta said the the vegetables were over cooked and sauce was not very good.

The restaurant was not crowded when we placed the order so all meals should have been scheduled to arrive at the same time.

data.title: Bill Chancellor
data.text: They have served great food and drinks for over 75 years. Anyone open for business that long, has to be the place to go.

data.title: Delicious Pizza
data.text:
While traveling thru Bloomington, we took a gamble on a local restaurant.  It is obvious that the restaurant has been there for a long time and very popular with locals, always a good sign.  We got the last table at 5:30.  The pizza was very fresh with good sausage and lots of cheese.  Our waitress was efficient 
and bubbley.  We enjoyed our dinner.  Not sure I would want to see the interior of the restaurant in bright light

data.title: Always AWESOME
data.text: You can't beat this institution - great pizza, food, staff, service and environment.  I go here with friends and sit downstairs, or with family and enjoy the upstairs.  The Baldini Pizza is my favorite....

data.title: Mamma Mia
data.text: Best Pizza in the mid west, quaint with old time neighborhood atmosphere. Excellent wait staff....But make reservations.....very popular eatery.

data.title: GREAT PIZZA
data.text: This is a bar that has great eats. No white table clothes. Just good food and service. Has a dining area upstairs for those not wanting bar atmosphere.
